website_summaries.verdict: This product actually boosts the chair up, rather than putting an extra seat on top of the chair.Compact, portable, and works under most dining chairs.
pros: Can hold a lot of weight and also works well for short adults
Stable enough to allow a child to climb up into the chair without toppling it over
Can fit your normal dining chairs
cons: This booster does not have any kind of a strap or device to help keep your young child from sliding off the chair
It is best for older children, rather than toddlers

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this I bought three for the kids but I'm buying another one because I'm short and I love the height. The pictures show one without, one with the tallest height adjustment and the other with the shorter height adjustment (doesn't seem like too much a difference but there is)
customer_reviews.author: SwierFamClan

customer_reviews.title: Update:  It broke.
customer_reviews.text: Edit: after about a year of use by a under 30lb child this broke. The center area had plastic snap off. My child could have been injured had she been in the chair when this collapsed. We liked the concept and it worked well for a bit. It has a light weight chair in it and only ever used by one small child gently. Risky. Really like this but two things to watch. Kid can tip if they want. Second is that it springs back super hard and fast so be careful putting on and off. Would buy again. Also, if table is low or has an overhang, night have trouble fitting under with kids legs.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon L

customer_reviews.title: Great for home use and great travelling option when you don't or can't bring a high chair.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our then one-year old. We wanted him to be able to sit at the dinner table and get him used to eating with the family versus having him kind of off to the side in his high chair. We'd just set his table setting at the table with the rest of us. It easily attaches on to the legs of chairs and I tried them on both our wooden chairs and our metal ones without any issues. If I did have a complaint I wish that the height were more adjustable but it should fit most standard sized tables just fine. Bar level height tables may be more of an issue.
customer_reviews.author: TechnoNerdTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I own four barstools that are too short for my current table. I attempted to find a solution to my problem by purchasing seat cushions, but I didn't particularly care for the way they looked. I eventually stumbled on to this product. I was skeptical whether it would work or not because my chair legs are awkwardly shaped (see attached photos) so I only purchased the one inorder to try it out. Suffice to say this invention definitely works, and I will be purchasing three more for my remaining chairs. It would be nice if the Kaboost wasn't so clunky and was more aesthetically pleasing...
customer_reviews.author: Nataki

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for boosting up our Oxo Tot Sprout High chair
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to boost up our Oxo Tot Sprout high chair so that my daughter was counter height when we sat at our kitchen island. Searching high and low, there are not many options for counter height chairs, and she still needs to be strapped into a chair - so we tried Kaboost. This worked perfectly! It took just a minute maybe to install, what a great idea and product. I like that when we don't need the high chair, we can use it to boost a regular chair afterward, so I see a lot of use out of it in the future. An added bonus - the chair is even sturdier WITH Kaboost, win-win.
customer_reviews.author: K. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Best booster, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product. We bought two for our kids. I love that they can easily be folded down so we can take them with us when we visit family. They're also super safe. The chairs are definitely MORE stable with the boosters on them, and the feet are so non-skid the chairs are hard to move around, which is great when you have very energetic toddlers! I also like that they don't significantly detract from the appearance of our dining room chairs like regular boosters would. My one (tiny) complaint is that they are a little harder to put on than advertised, but that's totally minor. Overall I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. Di Martino

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Invention
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my grandson during infrequent visits to my home This product is amazing - it is small and easy to store when not in use as well as easy to install. My grandson loves it - he has grown averse to sitting in a highchair, and the Kaboost is the perfect alternative to keep him at the correct height to enjoy meals with us. Thank you for an excellent and innovative product!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Simple way to help a toddler able to feed on their own with the family
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up, great to have our todler be at the table! Per feeding therapist recommendation, kids should sit with the table closer to stomach height rather than neck height. This booster works great for that! Our todler can now pick up her own cup, reach any of the food choices on the table, and feel like they are a part of the family!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Quality product but I prefer the standard booster
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent product but has a few nuances. I liked that it lifts the whole chair up but if your ever going to move it from chair to chair or anything, it’s a huge pain. You have to flip the chair over and fight the spring in it to get it on. Also, it’s got rubber grip on the bottom so you can’t slide the chair around with it attached, it sticks to the floor too much. It is very solid though and I had no concerns at all with stability (it’s actually more stable than a high chair or booster seat in my opinion)
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Works really well, but a bit too wide for the purpose for which it was purchased.
customer_reviews.text: It works extremely well. But we weren't able to use it for the chair we'd originally intended. My son need a booster to for our home desk in order to do first grade distance learning (covid mandated), and he didn't for in the chair. But with this product, he was definitely tall enough, but it widened the legs of the chair by a couple of inches making the chair too wide to for under the desk when he sat. We now have it at the dinner table for his little sister and it's great.
customer_reviews.author: GirlieTodd

customer_reviews.title: It works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: My grandson was resistant to sit in his high chair or on a booster. I got this and he thinks he's a real person now. He is much more cooperative and happy to eat his meals. It doesn't slide very well, which I think is intentional. You have to lift the chair a little to move it in and out, but it keeps him from pushing it around with his feet. It also has two heights so we can lower it an inch or so when he gets a little older. It collapses pretty small for transport.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Evarts

customer_reviews.title: Great riser
customer_reviews.text: I have a counter height table and stools (25") seat and a bar height bar with two stools (30") seat and a very high kitchen counter which I needed two (35") seat stools for, but the 35" seat height stools were quite pricey! So these Kaboost boosters work out well to raise the bar height stool to the 35" seat height I need to sit comfortably at the high kitchen counter. Pretty easy to put them on and off. And of course I use them for the counter height table to boost my grandson up instead of a cushion which never stays in place.
customer_reviews.author: W. Mischke

customer_reviews.title: Useful for therapy for extra height to a chair
customer_reviews.text: I am in physical therapy for a fractured kneecap. They needed me to hang my legs in a bent position with some pressure from an ankle weight. The extra height on our dining room chair made it possible to do this exercise to teach my knee to bend again. My daughter and son-in-law put it on my dining room chair it’s seem to need two people to install it. Seems very secure and doesn’t slip on the floor because of the rubber bottoms.
customer_reviews.author: Span

customer_reviews.title: Good for grown-ups too!
customer_reviews.text: I don't have any children. But the Kaboost has helped me create good ergonomics. I have carpel tunnel syndrome and tendinitis, so I need ideal ergonomics wherever I work. Twice a week, I visit a remote location where my work station has a chair that's too low for the table where I use my laptop PC. With the Kaboost, the chair has now been raised to a proper height relative to the table. Problem solved! My wrists and elbows now feel much better when I have to work at this location. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: dennisb_nc

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have found this a couple years ago. It’s exactly what we needed. Tried booster but he couldn’t get in it by himself. Tried the elevated cushion but it slid all over and we spent all dinner telling him to sit still. Price seems steep but it’s totally worth it. I see us using for a couple years and maybe again later for his little brother later ! Hope it lasts !
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our 20 month
customer_reviews.text: Our 20 month daughter was ready to get out of her highchair and into a dining room chair like her parents sit on. This thing boosted up the seat so she now fits at the table. It haw 2 height settings and the lower boost worked perfect for us. Make sure you get a step stool so they can climb up on their own. Watch out if you have collapsible chairs. The way this thing adjusts to different leg dimensions is with springs, so it might try to collapse the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: The perfect thing to put little ones at the table!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for us! Using a booster seat may get them to the right height, but the extra cleanup and concern about slippage, plus having to put them in and out of it - we wanted a better solution. Kaboost Booster is better than we hoped for! The two different height options, super easy installation, and really nice rubber feet - plus it perfectly matched the color of my chairs. The support for our little ones sense of independence is awesome. I will buy this again as a gift for others. Absolutely wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: FutureChef'sMom

customer_reviews.title: Great chair raiser for an adult with bad knees or after a surgery
customer_reviews.text: The booster appears to be marketed for kids but has a weight limit of 300 lbs. After a surgery I had trouble sitting on the regular height chairs. I tried using bed raisers, but they were sliding on the hardwood floor. Also it was a hassle to move it around. After I switched to Kaboost, the chair stopped sliding. Because Kaboost securely attaches to chair legs, it is easy to move chair around. I showed it to my physical therapist and she liked it a lot too.
customer_reviews.author: Olaf

customer_reviews.title: Perfect compromise for kids who want to be like adults
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for kids who are "too big" for a high chair or booster seat, but too small to reach the table. Our 3-year-old loves "his" chair with one of these on the bottom. He loves feeling like a big boy without needing to use a special booster or high chair when we eat at the table. It is super easy to install, though with my weak hands, I did need another adult to help. It grips and is spring loaded so it doesn't fall off. It can hold 200 lbs, so I'm ok to sit on it too without worrying about overloading the weight limits.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great product, better than we imagined
customer_reviews.text: Such a fantastic product. We have twins and hated the large footprint of two convertible high chairs. The Kaboost works as advertised. It’s footprint isn’t much larger than whatever chair you use it with, and the chair can slide under the table as normal with the rest of our chairs, so our dining room looks like adults use it again! It’s also great for nights that we have dinner on the patio, as they’re a cinch to move to a different chair. We were concerned about stability, but after a few months of three-year-olds climbing in and out on their own, I can tell you that they are quite stable.
customer_reviews.author: chrisdoubleyou

customer_reviews.title: Great product for young and old!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 82 year old mother who has really bad knees and couldn't get up from a regular height chair. This elevated the chair in a very safe and sturdy manner, allowing her to get off the chair without much pain. With the Kaboost on, it is very difficult to move the chair once a person is sitting on it. Therefore, I put some felt pads under it and that works great. I have already recommended this product for children and adults.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Thayer

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't sure at first... Now I'm a believer!  Great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that this would make his chair a little dangerous and more prone to tipping over, since it appeared to make it more top heavy... I couldn't have been more wrong. My son who is 3 and a little short for his age can climb up and down this extended height chair on his own and sit at the table in a comfortable position while being able to see into his plate from above rather than barely peaking over the side of the table. He's neater, and much more likely to use his utensils. The chair is very stable, and doesn't slide easily anymore, so it's actually a bit better than before. I really love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Steve G

customer_reviews.title: Meal time game changer
customer_reviews.text: This super easy to install booster is exactly what I had been searching for. My almost 2 year old hates not being able to sit and have meals at home in one of our normal dining chairs. This solved our problem, he will now sit and eat his entire meal without me having to hear him whine. I paired it with a chair cover to protect my upholstered chairs.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: The Kaboost is fantastic! My 2.5 year old struggled to climb over the arm of her old booster chair and had several terrible tumbles before I found it, not to mention, the seatbelts she no longer needed and refused to wear were disgustingly dirty and collected all kinds of food debris. The Kaboost is stable, allows her to easily climb in and out of her chair independently, and has no awkward openings to collect food debris. It also prevents her from sliding her chair, which spares our walls from dings. My older kids all like it so much that they have asked to have Kaboosts of their own. This product is worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I feel secure with the booster seat because it seems sturdy and stable
customer_reviews.text: I got the Kaboost about 10 days ago. My 23 months old is surprisingly not trying to escape the chair now that there is no restraints. I feel secure with the booster seat because it seems sturdy and stable. It does make the chair on the heavy side but it is a very minor inconvenient and I wouldn't want a booster seat that looks/feel to light anyway since it is supporting the child AND the chair. Overall a great product which I am most likely to buy again when my 2nd son reaches 2 years old in about 16 months from now.
customer_reviews.author: Ségolène

customer_reviews.title: I really like this product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my five year old granddaughter. She is remote learning due to Covid-19 and I have her set up in the dining room. She needed to be higher so that the teacher could see her on the computer screen. This is perfect. It can be placed on most any chair with legs and the tension on the apparatus keeps it in place on the chair. I do wish it had the option of about two more inches in height, but it is very sturdy, light weight, and easy to take along. The only tip I would give is put the chair upside down on a flat surface when attaching the Kaboost.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Love it but it makes it too difficult to pull the chair out
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and my son loves sitting in a "big boy chair". My only issue is that there are rubber pads at the bottom to keep the chair from skidding. That sounds like a smart idea until you (or a little one) try to pull the chair out. It's virtually impossible without picking the chair up and after about two weeks, I couldn't take it anymore. My independent 3 year old grew very frustrated about not being able to pull the chair out himself. I was able to fix this by attaching brown self-adhesive felt pads to the bottom. Now it's great but I wish I didn't have to spend about $7 on felt pads to fix this.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Eldridge

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me. Returning.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this product but unfortunately it does not work for me. Let me just start by saying that I see why others like it. It is sturdy and anti-slip on my shiny hard wood floors. However, it took some muscle just to put my chairs on it and when I finally got it all set up it was too high. There was a 2 inch space left between the chair and the table so my kids couldn't actually use the item. In theory it works but the table height has to be right. I happen to have a pub table and chair set so maybe that was the problem.
customer_reviews.author: LaceyLee

customer_reviews.title: Is your chair sitting too low for comfort?
customer_reviews.text: The Kaboost portable chair booster is one of the most well designed, highly functional, easy to use products I have purchased in several years. It really increases the chair height in a stable, simple to install manner. It is hard to imagine a chair with 4 legs that would not fit. I am surprised that they don't charge a premium for this extremely well designed, well made apparatus.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert A Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product for seniors
customer_reviews.text: I have had multiple joint replacements and osteoarthritis. I have trouble getting up from low or regular height seats. This booster is fantastic. I can easily get up with no assistance. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: isgold

customer_reviews.title: Adds stability!
customer_reviews.text: Our 14mo daughter has been using essentially a strap-in booster seat for meals for the last six months. It was great until recent weeks -- she's been going through a super-fussy-at-mealtime phase, throwing herself back and forth in tantrum... And shaking the chair under the booster seat back and forth in the process. Scary stuff. The Kaboost booster seat has been awesome. It adds so much stability (despite whatever thrashing Little One gives it!), plus works well, plus the bright green is a lot of fun. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Erin C

customer_reviews.title: For adults, too!
customer_reviews.text: This product is not only for kids -- it is for adults, too. I am 70+ years, and both of my knees are "shot". This booster allows me to easily sit higher which helps me to both stand and to sit. It is very sturdy. My only change would be to add furniture glides to make getting under the table easier -- as is, it doesn't easily slide. I would recommend this product for any age.!
customer_reviews.author: Claudi

customer_reviews.title: Good grief, just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product: it essentially fits most 4-legged chair bases, easily. So much better than having to look at a bulky booster seat (first world problems), or dealing with a booster seat that falls off the chair all the time... good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Hazelwood

customer_reviews.title: Great Invention
customer_reviews.text: Our child is almost 3 but has been fighting the bumbo booster seat for over a year. I wish I bought this a long time ago, but right now it's perfect for us! It allows for our child to use a regular chair, reach the table when sitting, climb in and out of the kitchen chair by herself, and it keeps it secure to the ground. We have to lift it up to push it in, but we only do that at dinner time and it's not as bad as I thought. Bye bye bumbo!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Faubion

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the Kaboost Booster Seat for our 3 year old grandson. It works fabulously and is easily assembled and taken down. It takes up very little storage space (we keep it in the bedroom closet). What a great product....so glad I purchased this instead of the traditional booster seat. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: MAM

customer_reviews.title: brilliant device
customer_reviews.text: I love this device - I only wish that I'd ordered another color. I thought that this booster was a lovely shade of grey, but it's actually a sort of hospital-industrial-complex beige-tan. At any rate, after his initial resistance, which lasted for an hour or so, my two-year-old LOVES climbing into his chair. And while I worried about him tumbling from the (higher) chair, he really seems safer, because he sits right at the table, and on his bottom rather than on his knees. The Kaboost gives him some autonomy, too, and it's a lovely transition from the hippo chair that suspended him from the table, legs dangling in the air.
customer_reviews.author: Riles

customer_reviews.title: Broke down after a few months :(
customer_reviews.text: We bought this 3 months ago and barely used this. Today I wanted to take it off the chair to change the height settings and when I did a few small pieces fell out if it. When I checked, I saw that it was broken! I'm happy I found out before it fell apart... Not using this anymore. Too bad, I thought it was a nice solution.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: counter-height seating.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this on a whim, and to be honest, I didn't really even understand how it worked and whether it would be safe. I was just frustrated by my inability to find kid-safe counter-height seating. Here's what I can tell you: This gets you there. You can use these to get normal height seats to be, more or less, counter-height. For like, a 5 year old or older. Yes. It will work. And the chair will be sturdy and stable. I took a random uninformed gamble - and discovered that these are great and really adaptable to any chair leg type.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: A MUST have for big kids!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok my son is 5 1/2. This is PERFECT. The chair is completely stable. Puts him at perfect height to eat over his plate. Wish i would have order this 1st instead or regular booster which made him sit weird in chair. I LOVE this thing. Also, with 2 different heights it can easily grow with him
customer_reviews.author: misty greek

customer_reviews.title: Great chair lifter, eliminating need for a booster seat.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and great for home or traveling. Bought one for our granddaughter who's adverse to using booster seats. KABOOST makes her feel like everyone else at the table. Liked it so much, we bought two more, one for travel and one for our daughter 's home.
customer_reviews.author: Son of Luckinbill Dancing

customer_reviews.title: Must buy for toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this. Came packaged well. Came NEXT DAY! Came on Tuesday, rather than Thursday. The brown matches our dining set very well. Love that there are 2 different height settings. The rubber on the feet is intense.... no slipping for sure. Maybe almost hard to scoot the chair though. Can’t wait to get rid of the crumb collecting booster seat!!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great product for your little one
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful idea, boosting your child raising your own type of chair. This product is clever and good to have, eliminating the need to purchase a booster seat. Your child will love sitting up. The only drawback is that it is a little clunky so you need to be aware of it when you walk around it as you may bump your feet and toes on it.
customer_reviews.author: mr.chinatown

customer_reviews.title: Works as needed!
customer_reviews.text: Works really well! Placed our kids Upseat on a kitchen chair and now she is table height level and we are able to feed her easier and she seems happy to be a part of dinner with everyone. One wish, somehow it could come with a latch or cord to keep closed for storage and travel. We are currently using a bungee cord to hold together when we take it places.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: This kabooster is amazing!!!!! Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fact that this product not only is for children. But for adults too i had a really low chair and i was very skeptical about this item not being able to work as i wanted and turned out that i received the package and opened it and extended the kabooster and let me tell you it did the JOB!!. It rise the chair completely the exact height i wanted. I really recommend this booster if you have a really low chair and want it high to match certain things this is the product for you!! Easy to put easy to clean easy to extend and put another chair you simply love.
customer_reviews.author: liss

customer_reviews.title: A great tool for toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: This seat booster is fantastic. It goes on easily, stays on easily, cleans easily, and comes off easily. Other than the height difference, an adult can sit in it without issue. It doesn't otherwise interfere with or damage the chair inside. After more than two years of constant use it still performs flawlessly. These work very well for kids in the 3-5 year old range.
customer_reviews.author: SE

customer_reviews.title: Kaboost boosts the dining experience for adults too!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 5’1” 104 lb. woman who is delighted with Kaboost. I can now enjoy sitting at my dining table for longer periods at the right height with an erect posture and no back cramps. And it is easy to slide in and out of my dining chair. The small ledges on each lift are great for comfort since my feet have a foot rest and don’t have to dangle. Before Kaboost, I struggled with the mobility of booster pillows which never gave me the stability or height I needed. I am very pleased with Kaboost.
customer_reviews.author: Susan B

customer_reviews.title: Just Right for sitting with the bigger kids at the Table
customer_reviews.text: I would've given it 5-stars all around but... but it takes some getting used to / or else the product needs to broken in. At first, the kids chair would not stay in the grooves when the chair was moved. After a couple of weeks, the booster legs moves right along with the chair as long as you gently pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Kaboost. AWSOME product.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item for my ninty five year old father. I was amazed quality of this product. It did the perfect job raising his kitchen table chair up to where he is better able to raise up out of his chair to leave the table. I would very much recommend this product to the young or old. Great product!!!! Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Ed Perryman

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to replace our booster seat. However, neither height setting was appropriate for our bar height dining table and chairs. This is something to keep in mind if buying. Both heights were too cramped and tight for child to sit comfortably. They probably work well with regular tables but not bar height. We had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Secure Hitech

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick!
customer_reviews.text: We hoped to use it to raise a chair with a round base for my disabled father. It made us too nervous for his situation but instead will use it for our granddaughter as soon her sister will be old enough for the one highchair that we have. Its lightweight, portable and we feel it is very secure for the square chair she will use.
customer_reviews.author: Babs

customer_reviews.title: A solid product with added benefits.
customer_reviews.text: The Kaboost is a sturdy and easy to use tool to raise a chair so your toddler can sit like a grown up at the table. Of course whether or not your toddler can sit still is another problem. The Kaboost has two other benefits: it prevents the chair from tipping back should your toddler push off from the table and it also does not slide on the floor due to its rubber grips. Really pleased with this purchase. Now to train the toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline C

customer_reviews.title: Elderly use
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my mother who has a hard time getting up and down. She needed a higher seat and this was not too high. It does NOT slide on the floor so that is a big plus. We put it on a swivel chair which was harder to although the instructions say not to. It is well worth the money for us!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great and sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: Our toddler loathed dinnertime, she really didn't like her highchair or booster seat anymore. We found if she sat on the "big girl chairs" she did great but eating was a challenge - in comes the KABOOST. She loves it. Sturdy, doesn't slip and went on easily. Really happy we found this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Not for Dining Table
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it, it brings the chair way too close to the edge of the table and it bothered my daughter every time we used it, her knees were keep hitting the edge of the table and we had to keep the chair away from the table since she couldn’t be under and it made it very uncomfortable, sorry
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, works on a lot of different chairs
customer_reviews.text: Great product. We bought one a few years ago for our oldest and were so happy with it we purchased a second when our youngest was old enough to use one. It has two heights, holds up well for everyday use, and folds small enough to be able to travel with it on vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Andrew Hagan

customer_reviews.title: Great buy and very effective
customer_reviews.text: My little boy loves it and it’s very sturdy and easy to apply.He’s grown out of the standard seat boosters so this is a terrific alternative. Would be nice if it came with a lap belt attachment but it’s a great buy nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Vinny Sivaraman

customer_reviews.title: Best Booster Seat There Is!
customer_reviews.text: Straightforward to setup, multiple height choices, and no booster seat marks on my chair from sliding around. Our daughter loves it. She can climb up herself (no booster seat falling over like at the restaurant) and be a big girl. My only quibbles might be it needs more color variety. The rubber pads, while effective at keeping it immobile on hardwood, are not what we wanted --- I added felt sliders to the bottom like all our chair have and now my daughter can slide it in and out herself as well.
customer_reviews.author: M. JohnsonTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: This is the greatest invention!
customer_reviews.text: I have now purchased two of the Kaboost chair booster -- one for my child's chair and one for my mother's (who is petite). They both love it! The booster is stylish, sturdy, and the best invention to add a lift without bulky seats and sliding cushions, which are often unsightly and unsafe. I recommend this product to all my friends with kids as well as to adults who are on the petite side. Excellent, excellent buy!
customer_reviews.author: Ninelle

customer_reviews.title: Helps Make Family Night perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have bought, I have family dinner night every Wednesday Night for my family. I had bought the first one from an add on facebook for my Granddaughter so my Grandson just got big enough to join us at the table I bought another one for him. They are both so proud that they can sit like the adults at the dinner table. I now have 12 people gathered round my table every Wednesday Night! Thank You for a great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Loving it
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great booster for any chair. I'm absolutely loving it. I like that nothing is placed on actual chair and you can keep your dinning area nice and clean. "I dont really like any extra stuff in the house" but this booster is amazing "unnoticed". It's very durable it has rubber things that holds dinning chair in place and prevents our laminated floor from scratching. Our 3 year old loves it too.
customer_reviews.author: Janna

customer_reviews.title: Great invention
customer_reviews.text: We love the KABOOST for my 3 year old great-nephew. He feels like such a big boy being able to sit right at the table. It's adjustable and easy to put on, but just because it's easy doesn't mean that it's not sturdy...I am pleased with how sturdy it is. I might even use the chair myself when working in the kitchen. I have a hard time standing for long periods of time which makes food prep and cooking a challenge. I've tried stools and they're not comfortable. I'm going to purchase another KABOOST so that my nephew has one at his house. Great invention!
customer_reviews.author: docsroc

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This KABOOST is excellent in raising the beautiful leather chairs that I purchased to go with my kitchen bar table. I didn’t like the original chairs that go with the table, but didn’t realize the chairs where too low. The KABOOST lifted them and now they are a perfect fit for my table. Excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: T. Cox

customer_reviews.title: This is a good buy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5 almost 6 year old son, who has grown out of his high chair but still needs a booster seat. This was just right. I hooked it up right away. It is sturdy on our tile floors. I does not slide, you have to lift the chair to move the chair. If this was height adjusted it would be great, but for now this will do. This will probably work for him for about 2 years. Overall, a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. View

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these installed on our chairs and found them to be very sturdy. The kids love the fact they are sitting in a chair just like me and my wife. This is very easy to install but because it installs on the base of the chair it isn’t as quick on and off as a regular booster. Overall I would recommend this over the traditional booster as the kids don’t seem to wobble as much as they would in a regular booster.
customer_reviews.author: Skirkwo2

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: This was all we needed for our three year old to be able to reach the table during dinner instead of sitting on her knees. Our taller four year old even likes it. We have had no issues with it. I like how it makes the chair grip the floor and keep it in place. My only concern (it hasn't happened, yet) is that the chair seems a little easier to tip backwards now that it is taller, if my child is turned around in the chair which she does often while I am in the kitchen cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Matt T.

customer_reviews.title: Happy child, happy Mom!
customer_reviews.text: I wish we bought this sooner! Our 1.5 year old hates his high chair and insists on sitting at the table with a real chair. We tried boosting him on stuff but he never lasted. Once we got this product it made dinner time seamless! He can even use the base to climb up into the chair! I can’t say enough good stuff about it!
customer_reviews.author: Laur-tastic

customer_reviews.title: Put it against a wall.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 2 1/2 yo grandson who was outgrowing his high chair. We do put the chair against the wall as he likes to put his feet against the table and push a regular chair away. Because of the grips on this it will tip if no wall behind it.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Bafaro

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This piece has been fantastic! We purchased it when our son was 3yo and have used it for 3 years in different settings. Initially it was purchased for his chair at the dining room table. Now we utilize it in a smaller pre-k/k style chair at an art table so he can work with us & his siblings while comfortable. This was certainly one of the better purchases we've made for long term use. I wish we had purchased this with our oldest child versus our youngest.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth P

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson had really outgrown his high chair at our house. He was old enough to sit at the table if he could be elevated. I found this product on Amazon and purchased it right away. It is perfect. At my dining room table I have it on the lower height, and if I move it to the kitchen I have it on the higher height. It is sturdy, which was my biggest concern when I ordered it. His parents liked it so much, they bought one for their house.
customer_reviews.author: madri_gal

customer_reviews.title: It would be nice to have the option of adding a thin felt ...
customer_reviews.text: It can be a little tricky figuring out how to get the chair onto the booster, especially if the chair is heavy. The rubber base really prevents the chair from moving on the floor. This makes sense, so kids do push themselves, but it can make it difficult to get a child on and off the chair as it can't be pulled out and pushed you...you have to actually lift the whole chair up. It would be nice to have the option of adding a thin felt pad to the botton for easier movement rather than the rubber footing. The two height options is great and allowed us to accommodate our growing child.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If f you have growing kids you NEED this...
customer_reviews.text: Genius idea was having trouble finding a chair for my 5 year old initially I was trying to get a taller chair but could not find the happy medium I was looking for. Was also tired of seeing her I'll sit on her butt or put her knees on the chair to reach the table. You should try to sell this to Bed Bath & Beyond awesome product I'm extremely satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice non-slip option
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old got a desk for virtual schooling that's intended for an adult. We have her set up with a dining room chair for now, and it's too short. The shorter boost height on this is perfect, and now we don't have to worry about a pad that will slip around.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Lifts too high, not attractive.
customer_reviews.text: This sounded like a really neat idea until we actually tried it. It has 2 settings for 2 different height boosts - which is a good thing. Unfortunately even the lowest setting was already borderline for our tall 2yo toddler and it seemed obvious she would be uncomfortable in it within a couple of months. Additionally this thing isn't a very attractive addition to your living area. I feel like this is yet another case of someone trying to solve a problem that didn't really exist - we got a nice booster pillow instead which cost way less and serves us well, reliably, and neatly.
customer_reviews.author: L. G.

customer_reviews.title: Better than a booster seat
customer_reviews.text: My tiny 3 year old got to where he wanted to get in and out of the chair on his own, which was difficult with the booster. This works well, although does make the chair a little higher than necessary. I added felt furniture pads to the bottom because the chair would not scoot at all across my tile floor with the rubber grip on this. Over all, I'm happy. Maybe a little overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: HappyMomAndSons

customer_reviews.title: Needed for an adult
customer_reviews.text: I bought this, not for a child, but for an adult who suddenly has difficulty rising from sitting to standing. Having a chair that is higher is just what was needed. This gives you two choices, so it is not entirely adjustable, but the higher adjustment was what we needed. I needed a second pair of hands to steady the chair while I pulled the third and fourth pieces out to the length needed. The buyer might need to be aware of that if they are buying it for an adult's use. Possibly a parent buying this for children is young enough and in good enough health to secure this without the help of another person.
customer_reviews.author: Abbijoy

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should!
customer_reviews.text: Got the brown one...my 5 year old loves it! She finally freaking sits still (mostly) at the table. It stays on the chair when you pick it up, and went on easily. We’ll probably take it on vacation this year. You can’t slide the chair with it on because of the rubber bottoms on the feet, but that’s a safety thing so that’s good. It’s pricy, but cheaper than buying a whole bar height chair!
customer_reviews.author: Heather B

customer_reviews.title: Second Kaboost we've owned
customer_reviews.text: We Love Kaboost! It was the perfect solution for our oldest and when our second one had outgrown her booster but was still too short to reach a regular chair we knew just what to get. This seat allows the child to feel like they are in a regular chair while still boosting them up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon mom

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Only downside is when my son is ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Only downside is when my son is in the seat it's hard to push the chair in and the legs keep coming out of the Kaboost making the chair unstable and my son has almost fallen because of that. If the legs of the Kaboost had some sort of felt on it to make it easier to slide, it would be better. We tried to buy felt for the bottom, but none of the type in the store fits the bottom or makes it uneven.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just ok, like but don't love.
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would love this, but I just like it. My favorite feature is that you don't have to buy a new chair, and your table doesn't scream "little kids eat here". However what I don't like is that the sticky grippers which are designed to keep the chair from slipping/slidding all over make it impossible for a child to push themselves in and out. Consequently my 3 year old always needs help getting properly adjusted. Not a deal braker, but slightly annoying. The product is constructed well, functions exactly as promised, and seems extremely safe and secure.
customer_reviews.author: lillady977

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: This looked like a great idea to allow my 3 year old to sit on the chair like the rest of us and it did IS! I love this as a booster seat alternative! It’s fantastic. We do have to slide our chairs in and out on a wood floor so I stuck a felt pad on the rubber non-slip feet and it’s working perfectly. I doesn’t slide around, it keeps the chair stable as well or better than original chair legs alone. I recommend this for all parents trying to give their kids the ability to feel like an equal at the table.
customer_reviews.author: Momofcul

customer_reviews.title: What a great product! This has been a total game changer
customer_reviews.text: What a great product! This has been a total game changer. My 18 month old would not sit in any booster. He would try getting out no matter what, and it was really getting dangerous. He just wanted a regular chair. Plus, after he'd throw down teh booster, he'd stand up and rock his chair, and a few times he knocked it over before I had a chance to grab him. This product lifts him up so he can reach the table and eat properly, while feeling like he's ona regular chair. And it's practically impossible to knock over the chair with this- especially with the grip pads. Total winner!
customer_reviews.author: Vichna Belsky

customer_reviews.title: Great for Homeschool!
customer_reviews.text: Our twin first graders are being homeschooled because of the pandemic and our schools haven't opened. We tried car booster seats, pillows, and purchased cushions. They were not happy with any of them until we found the Kaboost! They now can sit at our tables comfortably without too much wiggling to participate with their teacher and classmates on their laptops and do their assigned work. The only thing that bothers them is that their chairs don't slide now, which may be a good thing!
customer_reviews.author: KSR

customer_reviews.title: Inventor should be a millionaire!! Love it
customer_reviews.text: This booster/chair raiser what ever you want to call it is amazing!! Whoever invented this will be a millionaire! It’s an amazing idea!! So easy to add to a chair (less then 5 minutes to install). Perfect height for my granddaughter and she feels like such a big girl! I would recommend to anyone looking for a booster seat to get this instead!! So cool!
customer_reviews.author: C. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful booster.
customer_reviews.text: I love this booster for our little guy. We wanted to get out of the highchair and up to the table like a big boy. But all the booster pads slip around and are a pain to keep clean. Not this. Go's on easy, grips the floor and wipes clean very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing product for my 2 1/2-year-old grandson
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product for my 2 1/2-year-old grandson. He really responding well to being able to sit at the table like a big boy and he loved it. I actually bought two of these, one for my son and daughter-in-law at their house but you have to be careful and not have a bottom lip on the table otherwise it doesn't work so well my table does not have one so it works perfectly. I would highly recommend this it's good for growing family while the younger child can use the high chair of the older child can use this.
customer_reviews.author: Juliann McAdam

customer_reviews.title: Super handy
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I'm buying a second one for another grandchild. It blends in nicely with the furniture so I can leave it out and on the chair without it looking like cluttered kid stuff. It brings my 3 year old right up to the table. it is really slip-resistant and very study. It stays on the chair with out any slipping. Bets the high chair any day.
customer_reviews.author: toolin4fun

customer_reviews.title: Meets a transitional need without requiring additional space or furniture
customer_reviews.text: With twin grandsons, needing two of everything already presents economic challenges. I did not want to also need twice as much space, nor permanent objects for a temporary use. Now that they want a big-boy chair, this apparatus allows me to use furniture I already have, safely, and I am still able to remove and store it easily if I don't want it for adult-only gatherings. It also has the added convenience of being easily portable in a separately-purchased tote bag for visits to friends or restaurants.
customer_reviews.author: DKC

customer_reviews.title: 2 year old can sit at the table now!
customer_reviews.text: The Kaboost has really helped our toddler sit at the table. She refused to use a regular booster seat and would try to kneel on the chair, but it became too uncomfortable. Now she is able to sit regularly with us as a family. We haven't use it to travel yet, but it seems very portable.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 3 kids!
customer_reviews.text: My only disappointment is that I didn't find this product sooner! The boosters I had previously scratched my wooden chairs. This product does exactly what it says it will do. It fits my wooden chairs perfectly and my three kids love them! I did have to buy an extra strap to prevent my one year olds from getting down from the table before their food covered hands were wiped but that's no issue. Everyone who sees these boosters thinks they are the greatest invention ever and I have to admit, I agree!
customer_reviews.author: MomOf3

customer_reviews.title: Works great for adults too
customer_reviews.text: My chair was too short for my computer desk. Bed risers were too wobbly and I wasn't sure what else to use when I saw Kaboost on Amazon. Very easy to put on my chair and very secure! The springs hold Kaboost onto my chair and it does NOT come off when I lift my chair up to move it. I'm a 5'9 adult and this booster seat holds my weight no problem. Great product!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We recently got a new counter height dining table, and I was looking for a way to easily raise up our baby's high chair without having to get a new one. I was very impressed with how well this product fit to the odd shaped high chair legs and how sturdy it is. I was worried that it would feel wobbly, but it is extremely stable. It doesn't slide well with the rubber pads, but that's a small price to pay to have our little guy safe and secure. I'm very happy with this purchase and recommend it for anyone looking to give their little one a boost so they can be part of family meals.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A big help. Works well
customer_reviews.text: It is a big help eating at my dining room table. The only problem I have with it I slept there during the day also because it’s the only chair I don’t have trouble getting up from. But my legs dangle and don’t touch the floor and my legs go to sleep. Otherwise it works great. I like it. I do have to be careful turning it on my carpet. It did come apart once. But it is very secure other than that one time.
customer_reviews.author: sally spencer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient way to raise child to table level
customer_reviews.text: The Kaboost folded/unfolded easily and fit on the bottom of the standard kitchen or dining room chairs. Very sturdy and the child is sitting in the regular chair itself. There are no attaching straps but these are not necessary if the child is old enough to sit in a regular chair by himself already. The Kabooast is much better than the old "booster" seats.
customer_reviews.author: DBC

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t be more safe, convenient or developmentally appropriate.
customer_reviews.text: Love that this allows the little one to use the same seat as we do, and is so incredibly sturdy that a 3 year old can climb up into it by themselves. We put a step stool in front and say to scoot up (to the edge of the seat) until feet touch the stool. This posture helps w digestion, and the chair never has to be moved (so sturdy that it doesn’t “scoot” anyways). Can also easily pack this up and take to family gatherings where we have used makeshift pillow “booster seats”. This is a great solution that provides autonomy and inclusion at the highest level!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome substitute for a high chair!!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the most awesome products I have purchased!! This allows parents and GRANDPARENTS to have seating for the kids without having to store highchairs. The best thing about it is 3-5 year old resist high chairs, cry etc. This allows them to sit like their older siblings and be able to reach the table. It solved both problems for me. Now the little one feels a part of the family dinner!! (Probably not for under 3)
customer_reviews.author: R Case

customer_reviews.title: Easy, quick solution to high chair problem!
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect solution for my daughter. Her chair fits perfectly still under our table and helped free up space getting rid of the high chair. Definitely worth the money! It was super easy to install and took only a minute or so.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great design!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great design! I wish I’d gotten one when my son was a toddler! We just got it so the he can be the right height to do 1st grade in Zoom classes. It is such a great concept and works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: S. Crotts

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this booster
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this booster. My grandchildren all sit around the kitchen counter bar area on bar stools and my two year old had to always sit on her knees because our booster seats would not fit on the bar stool safely. The Kaboost seat worked perfectly, she can sit at the counter like her big brother and sisters. The others fight to sit in her spot when she's not there, lol.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: I was looking for a solution that would help her sit at the table like the big kid she is without being relegated to ...
customer_reviews.text: With a very petite 5-year old, I was looking for a solution that would help her sit at the table like the big kid she is without being relegated to a "baby chair". For a while she sat on her knees, but that just led to a bad case of the wiggles and falling out of the chair. But with this unique solution, she can sit properly in a chair. She doesn't even realize it's there. She's able to sit at the table with the pride associated with being a "big kid" while firmly planted in her seat so she's not moving all over her chair (and the floor).
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie M. Bibeau

customer_reviews.title: Great for 14mo old and 5yo!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I bought it for my 14 month old who keep climbing out of his high chair. I ended up buying a second because my 5yo took the first one a bought. The lower height is perfect for my 5yo and the higher height is perfect for my 14 month old. I debated about this vs a regular booster seat but I’m glad I bought this instead.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

product_meta.title: KABOOST Booster Seat for Dining Table, Chocolate - Goes Under The Chair - Portable Chair Booster for Toddlers
product_meta.description:
Color:ChocolateKABOOST is a booster seat for dining that goes under the chair! The portable chair booster is perfect for little kids who want to sit like big kids. Product Features: Compact and lightweight booster chair alternative • Tested and approved • Snaps-on chair in seconds – quick and easy to use, stays attached when chair is moved • Rubberized feet – non-slip, won’t scratch floors, grips chair legs firmly into place • Sturdy design – engineered to improve chair stability, holds up to 300 pounds • Adjustable spring system – fits 4-legged chairs, round, square or curvy legs • Two height positions – same heights as standard booster seats (3.75” and 4.5”) • Grows with your child • Weighs only 3.5 lbs • Easy to fold and carry – perfect for taking to grandparents, friends and restaurants • No assembly required • Fits chair with a max diagonal distance of 30" • Dimensions: 13” x 12” x 6.75”

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
KABOOST is the portable chair booster that raises the height of a chair by simply snapping underneath a 4 legged chair in seconds. It is engineered to improve chair stability and stays attached when the chair is moved. By raising the height of the chair, little kids can sit like big kids at the table. It is portable and lightweight, 3.5 pounds, easy to take with you to grandparents or restaurant.
feature_bullets: #1 RATED TODDLER BOOSTER – Fits 4 legged chairs (round, square or curvy legs)
NO ASSEMBLY REQUIRED – SNAPS ON CHAIR IN SECONDS straight out of the box and stays attached even when chair is moved
ENGINEERED TO IMPROVE CHAIR STABILITY – Holds up to 300 lbs. – Rubberized feet are non-slip and won't scratch floors

GROWN-UPS USE KABOOST TOO – Helps adults with knee pain, joint pain, arthritis and hip problems to sit and stand on their own and for those who just need a little extra boost. From toddlers to grown-ups, grandparents and seniors!

COMPACT & LIGHTWEIGHT – Weighs only 3 ½ lbs., easily folds for storage and travel and has 2 height positions (3.75" & 4.5"), same heights as standard booster seats, allowing it to grow with your child

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars2,795 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
